DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the performance of an insulin pump controlling algorithm while the subject is under close medical supervision in the Clinical Research Center (CRC) setting.
DOC.brief_title: Feasibility Study Assessing The Ability Of An Insulin Pump-Controlling Algorithm To Minimize Hypoglycemia And Hyperglycemia In Patients With Type 1 Diabetes In A Clinical Research Setting
DOC.detailed_description: This study is a non-randomized, uncontrolled feasibility study that looks to enroll people with type 1 diabetes who are currently using an insulin pump. During the subject's participation, the study staff will closely monitor the study subject in a clinical research center environment for approximately 24 hours, while controller algorithm determined insulin doses are delivered by an insulin pump, and utilizing continuous glucose monitoring results. Total subject participation approximately 1 week for screening to completion. This includes approximately 24 hours usage of the investigation device in the clinical research center under close medical supervision.
DOC.criteria: Summary of Key inclusion/exclusion criteria: Age 2165 years Type 1 diabetes mellitus for at least one year Using an insulin infusion pump for at least the past 6 months Pregnancy History of diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) in the past six months History of severe hypoglycemia (seizure, unconsciousness) in the past 6 months Other Inclusion/Exclusion criteria apply. Please contact clinical study site for complete details.
